creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: eight full lines of text, confidently, clearly written characters on a sheet of thick white paper; once folded in half down the center
inscription: 今夕何夕。。。 (What evening is this evening? / By chance has come this fine occassion. / For a thousand ages we share this style, / three men have been our teachers. / Our drinking now is based on letters; / the Way we would never refuse. / We harmonize feelings by means of wine, / empty our wills by means of poems. / How joyful is the superior man, / when all phenomena suit his mood! / Just follow what Heaven has fated for you, / Ah! what limit does it have?) [Jonathan Chaves]
title: Visiting my Elder-Brother-in-Poetry
